Adult Education

 ADED 305   PORTFOLIO DEV FOR PLAR           3.0    $442.20  Prerequisite(s): One of the following: (enrolment in an
                                                             Adult Education program) or (30 university-level credits)
                                                             or (permission of the Adult Education department). 

      10032 ON1 Janice Johnson                  ONLINE UFV                              05-JAN-2015 13-APR-2015      25
                                                ABD    225              S 1000  1400    17-JAN-2015 17-JAN-2015
                                                ABD    225              S 1000  1400    31-JAN-2015 31-JAN-2015
                                                ABD    225              S 1000  1400    28-FEB-2015 28-FEB-2015
                                                ABD    225              S 1000  1400    28-MAR-2015 28-MAR-2015                                               

            This course meets four Saturdays for four hours on January 17,31, February 28 and March 28. Web-Ex
            participation will be provided for distance students. All remaining classes are conducted online.
            Online courses open at noon on Jan 5. Students are expected to login soon after that.
            Students MUST login by noon Jan 7 or risk losing their spot in the course.
            -- Start the online course at http://myclass.ufv.ca/ or http://my.ufv.ca --

            Hybrid format - Some of the classroom instruction time has been moved to online. For example, one class in four will
            take place online, or in-class time is significantly reduced and replaced with online activities.

            each week during the semester and some course components            MAJOR: Bachelor of Fine Arts            8

            will be online. For example, the course outline and handouts        MAJOR: Visual Arts Diploma              4

            will be online, quizzes may be conducted through the LMS,           MAJOR: Visual Arts Extended             2

            assignments are handed in through the LMS, students use

            online resources to supplement the textbook, etc.

            Online components can be accessed at http://myclass.ufv.ca/ or http://my.ufv.ca

 COMP 155   OBJECT-ORIENTED PROGRAMMING      4.0    $589.60  Prerequisite(s): COMP 150 or COMP 152 with a grade of C+ or better. 

      10387 AB1 Paul Kroeker                    ABD    223         M      1515  1850  05-JAN-2015 13-APR-2015     35
                                                                                Int'l Students seat reserve            17

             Technology-enhanced - Students still meet in the classroom each week during the semester and some course components
            will be online. For example, the course outline and handouts will be online, quizzes may be conducted through the LMS,
            assignments are handed in through the LMS, students use online resources to supplement the textbook, etc.
            Online components can be accessed at http://myclass.ufv.ca/ or http://my.ufv.ca 

      10388 ON1 Paul Kroeker                    ONLINE UFV                            05-JAN-2015 13-APR-2015     35
            NOTE: All material will be presented online with OPTIONAL

            weekly face-to-face review and lab sessions on Wednesdays at 15:15-17:20 at Chilliwack CEP Room A0024.
            This is an ideal opportunity for students wishing to try out online studies yet still have regular class room
            interaction. Since the lab sessions are optional there is no need to attend them, making it a genuine online
            course for those so inclined, although it is advantageous to attend the introductory first class.
            This section will have a classroom based midterm and final exam. The midterm will be scheduled at the
            same time as the lab sessions for this class. If you choose to take another class at the same time you will have
            to skip that class to write the midterm. Final exam dates are announced later in the semester.

            Online courses open at noon on Jan 5. Students are expected to login soon after that.
            Students MUST login by noon Jan 7 or risk losing their spot in the course.
            -- Start the online course at http://myclass.ufv.ca/ or http://my.ufv.ca --

 EDUC 230   INFO SERVICES FOR CHILDREN       3.0    $442.20  Prerequisite(s): None 

      10517 ON1 Christina Neigel                ONLINE UFV                            05-JAN-2015 13-APR-2015     10
            Combined with LIBT 230.  Credit cannot be obtained for both EDUC 230 and LIBT 230

            Students residing outside the Metro Vancouver/Lower Mainland region may choose to write schedule midterm and final exams
            on the Abbotsford campus or through invigilation at a designated post-secondary institution. Students residing
            within the Metro Vancouver/Lower Mainland region may be required to use resources located on the Abbotsford campus
            and are required to write scheduled midterm and final exams on the Abbotsford campus. All exams must be written on the
            date and time established either by the instructor or, in the case of final exams, according to the UFV final exam
            schedule.

            Prior to starting LIBT classes, students are required to complete an orientation to BBLearn located in the LIBIT
            Orientation and Resources at https://myclass.ufv.ca

            NOTE: Criminal Record Check required. Instructions will be sent to all registered students.

            Online courses open at noon on Jan 5. Students are expected to login soon after that.
            Students MUST login by noon Jan 7 or risk losing their spot in the course.
            -- Start the online course at http://myclass.ufv.ca/ or http://my.ufv.ca --

      11323 CH1 Mark Friesen                    CEPA   1362         T     1130  1420  05-JAN-2015 24-APR-2015     22

            Hybrid format - Some of the classroom instruction time has been moved to online. For example, one class in four will
            take place online, or in-class time is significantly reduced and replaced with online activities. 
            Online components can be accessed at http://myclass.ufv.ca/ or http://my.ufv.ca

            Students MUST login by noon Jan 7 or risk losing their spot in the course.

 ENGL 105   ACADEMIC WRITING                 3.0    $442.20  Prerequisite(s): English 12 or English Literature 12 with
                                                             a minimum final grade of C+ or better; UFV CMNS 099 or
                                                             ENGL 099 with a grade of C or better; UFV ENGL 081 or 091
                                                             with a grade of C+ or better; UFV ESL WG84 with a grade
                                                             of C+ or better; a minimum grade of C- in a university
                                                             level English or Communications course; CPT score of 48
                                                             or better; LPI score of 30 (level 5); TOEFL (Test of
                                                             English as a Foreign Language) score of 570 or better (or
                                                             230 if computer-based score), plus a minimum TWE or essay
                                                             score of 4.0; or IBT score of 88, with no section below
                                                             20; MELAB (Michigan English Language Assessment Battery)
                                                             score of at least 85; CAEL (Canadian Academic English
                                                             Language) score of at least 70; CanTEST score of at least
                                                             4.5 in both Listening and Reading and a score of 4.0 in
                                                             Writing; Cambridge Proficiency Examination  competence
                                                             level of C; IELTS (International English Language Testing
                                                             System) score of at least 6.5 with no band less than 6.0;
                                                             UFV English as a Second Language assessment results
                                                             equivalent to completion of the 80-level of UFVs ESL
                                                             writing and grammar.

 ENGL 108   INTRODUCTION TO LITERATURE       3.0    $442.20  Prerequisite(s): One of the following: English 12 or
                                                             English Literature 12 with a final grade of B or better;
                                                             CMNS 099 or ENGL 099 with a grade of C or better; ENGL 081
                                                             or ENGL 091 with a grade of C+ or better; ESL WG84
                                                             with a grade of C+ or better; CPT score of 48 or better;
                                                             LPI minimum score of 30/40 or level 5 in the essay
                                                             section; a minimum of C- in a university-level English or
                                                             Communications course; or TOEFL (Test of English as a
                                                             Foreign Language) score of 570 or better (or 230 if
                                                             computer-based score), plus a minimum TWE (Essay) score
                                                             of 4.0 or TOEFL IBT score of 88, with no section below 20.

 ENGL 200   INTRO TO LIT CRITICAL METHODS    3.0    $442.20  Prerequisite(s): Any two 100-level English courses,
                                                             numbered ENGL 105 or higher. 

      10570 AB1 John Pitcher                    ABD    117         M W    1430  1550  05-JAN-2015 13-APR-2015     28 
            This course is recommended for English Majors & English Honours

COURSE DESCRIPTION
 This course will focus on strategies for reading literature and writing literary critical essays. The course will include
instruction in the conventions of the literary essay, and students will be guided in reading and writing about the three
major genres: Fiction, poetry, and drama.

Note: This course will be accepted as a fulfilling a 200 level requirement for all English major, minor & extended minors, all
English concentrations, as well as English Honours.

 ENGL 386   FIGURATIVE LANGUAGE              4.0    $589.60  Prerequisite(s): Any two 200-level English courses.                                                           

      10596 AB1 Hilary Turner                   ABD    217          T R   1345  1510  05-JAN-2015 13-APR-2015     25
            This course may be applied to upper level Rhetoric                         MAJOR: English                         14
            Concentration requirements. 16 credits from ENGL 370, 371,                 English Extended Minor           3           
COURSE DESCRIPTON:
Students will study figurative language (figures of speech and tropes) by reading key texts in rhetorical and literary theory
from Aristotle to the twentieth century, and will assess its significance in poetry and other arts. 

Note: This course will be accepted in the upper level requirement in the rhetoric concentration as well as the ENGL major and honours.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

                                                 ABD    217           W    1515  1720 

            Technology-enhanced - Students still meet in the classroom                 MAJOR: English                         14
            each week during the semester and some course components                   English Extended Minor           3
            will be online. For example, the course outline and handouts
            will be online, quizzes may be conducted through the LMS, assignments are handed in through the LMS, students use
            online resources to supplement the textbook, etc.
            Online components can be accessed at http://myclass.ufv.ca/ or http://my.ufv.ca

 ENGL 405   SEMINAR IN CREATIVE WRITING      4.0    $589.60  Prerequisite(s): Any two 300 level English courses to
                                                             include one of the following: ENGL 302, 303, 311, 313,
                                                             315, 317, 377, 378, 381. 

      10598 AB1 John Carroll                    ABA    210          T R   1515  1720  05-JAN-2015 13-APR-2015     20
            Students can substitute ENGL 405 for ENGL 490                       CONCENTRATION: Creative Writing         8
            in Honours CRWR & Major-Creative Writing Concentration.             MAJOR: English Honours                  2
COURSE DESCRIPTON:
This course allows students to work on individual, advanced creative writing projects. Students engage in genre-based critical
discourse, give a presentation on the work of a contemporary author, as well as produce a completed manuscript. Revision is an
essential component with students significantly redrafting their work to produce the final project by the end of the course.

                                                             production. It is recommended that students have Film 110

                                                             portfolio review. One of the following is strongly

            take place online, or in-class time is significantly reduced and replaced with online activities.  Online components can
            be accessed at http://myclass.ufv.ca/ or http://my.ufv.ca

 Library & Information Technology 

 LIBT 100   INTRO. TO INFORMATION SERVICES   3.0    $442.20  Prerequisite(s): None     Corequisite(s): None 

      10855 ON1 Louise Broadley                 ONLINE UFV                            05-JAN-2015 13-APR-2015     36
            Students residing outside the Metro Vancouver/Lower Mainland        MAJOR: Library and Info Tech Dipl      23
            region may choose to write scheduled midterm and final exams
            on the Abbotsford campus or through invigilation at a designated post-secondary institution. Students residing
            within the Metro Vancouver/Lower Mainland region may be required to use resources located on the Abbotsford campus
            and are required to write scheduled midterm and final exams on the Abbotsford campus. All exams must be written on the
            and time established either by the course instructor or, in the case of final exams, according to the UFV final exam
            schedule.

            Prior to starting LIBT classes, students are required to complete an orientation to BBLearn located in the LIBIT
            Orientation and Resources at https://myclass.ufv.ca

            Online courses open at noon on Jan 5. Students are expected to login soon after that.
            Students MUST login by noon Jan 7 or risk losing their spot in the course.
            -- Start the online course at http://myclass.ufv.ca/ or http://my.ufv.ca --

 LIBT 220   DBASE MGT & SWARE IMPLEM         3.0    $442.20  Pre- or corequisite(s): LIBT 120 and admission to the
                                                             Library and Information Technology program 

      10862 ON1 Christina Neigel                 ONLINE UFV                            05-JAN-2015 13-APR-2015     36

            Students residing outside the Metro Vancouver/Lower Mainland        MAJOR: Library and Info Tech Dipl      11

            region may choose to write scheduled midterm and final exams

            on the Abbotsford campus or through invigilation at a designated post-secondary institution. Students residing

            within the Metro Vancouver/Lower Mainland region may be required to use resources located on the Abbotsford campus

            and are required to write scheduled midterm and final exams on the Abbotsford campus. All exams must be written on the

            date and time established either by the instructor or, in the case of final exams, according to the UFV final exam

            schedule.

            Prior to starting LIBT classes, students are required to complete an orientation to BBLearn located in the LIBIT

            Orientation and Resources at https://myclass.ufv.ca  

            Online courses open at noon on Jan 5. Students are expected to login soon after that.
            Students MUST login by noon Jan 7 or risk losing their spot in the course.
            -- Start the online course at http://myclass.ufv.ca/ or http://my.ufv.ca --
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 LIBT 230   INFO SERVICES FOR CHILDREN       3.0    $442.20  Prerequisite(s): None. 

      10863 ON1 Christina Neigel                ONLINE UFV                            05-JAN-2015 13-APR-2015     26
            Combined with EDUC 230.                                             MAJOR: Library and Info Tech Dipl      22

            Credit cannot be obtained for both LIBT 230 and EDUC 230.

            Students residing outside the Metro Vancouver/Lower Mainland region may choose to write scheduled midterm and final exams

            on the Abbotsford campus or through invigilation at a designated post-secondary institution. Students residing

            within the Metro Vancouver/Lower Mainland region may be required to use resources located on the Abbotsford campus

            and are required to write scheduled midterm and final exams on the Abbotsford campus. All exams must be written on the

            date and time established either by the instructor or, in the case of final exams, according to the UFV final exam

            schedule.

            Prior to starting LIBT classes, students are required to complete and orientation to BBLearn located in the LIBIT

            Orientation and Resources at https://myclass.ufv.ca 

            NOTE: Criminal Record Check required. Instructions will be sent to all registered students.  

            Online courses open at noon on Jan 5. Students are expected to login soon after that.
            Students MUST login by noon Jan 7 or risk losing their spot in the course.

            -- Start the online course at http://myclass.ufv.ca/ or http://my.ufv.ca --

                                                             one of Principles of Math 11 or MATH 085) or (C or better
                                                             in both Foundations of Mathematics 11 and Precalculus 11)
                                                             or (B or better in one of Foundations of Mathematics 11
                                                             or Precalculus 11) or (C+ or better in Applications of

                                                             Precalculus 12 or MATH 096; or both MATH 094 and MATH 095) 

      10886 AB1 Susan Milner                    ABB    132         M      1000  1210  05-JAN-2015 13-APR-2015     36
                                                ABB    132           W    1000  1210

 MATH 110   PRE-CALCULUS MATH                4.0    $589.60  Prerequisite(s): One of the following: (C or better in

                                                             one of Principles of Math 12 or Precalculus 12) or (C- or

                                                             better in both MATH 094 and MATH 095) or (C- in MATH 096)

                                                             or (C+ or better in Applications of Math 12) or (at least

                                                             55% on the MDPT).

            be accessed at http://myclass.ufv.ca/ or http://my.ufv.ca

                                                             45 university-level credits with department permission.

 STAT 106   STATISTICS I                     4.0    $589.60  Prerequisite(s): One of the following: (C or better in
                                                             one of Principles of Mathematics 12, Applications of
                                                             Mathematics 12, Foundations of Mathematics 12, Pre-
                                                             calculus 11, MATH 096, MATH 110, MATH 124, or MATH 140)
                                                             or (C or better in both MATH 094 and MATH 095) or (Pre-
                                                             calculus 12) or (a score of 17/25 or better on Part B of
                                                             the MSAT together with a score of 34/50 or better on
                                                             Parts A and B combined). 

      11120 AB1 David Chu                       ABD    219          T R   0830  0950  05-JAN-2015 13-APR-2015     36
                                                ABD    226             F  0830  0950  05-JAN-2015 13-APR-2015
                                                                                      Accounting Cert                   1
                                                                                      Business Administration Dipl      8
                                                                                      Business Administration Deg       9
                                                                                      BBA Aviation                      3 

      11121 AB2 Camilo Martinez                 ABD    217          T R   1130  1250  05-JAN-2015 13-APR-2015     36
